programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on the Sky Cinema channels, plus other highlights showing on Sky.(n)

programme.title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
programme.desc: A Victorian scientist investigating the mysterious sinking of whaling ships in the Pacific falls overboard during an attack on his vessel. Along with a veteran mariner and a diver, he is picked up and taken captive by Captain Nemo and whisked away on a series of adventures in his futuristic submarine. Disney fantasy, based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Kirk Douglas, James Mason, Paul Lukas and Peter Lorre.(n)

programme.title: After Earth
programme.desc: A spaceship crash leaves a renowned war hero and his 13-year-old son stranded on Earth, which was abandoned by the human race centuries ago. Since mankind's departure, the planet has become home to all manner of dangerous life-forms, and the boy must make a desperate journey across hostile terrain to secure a rescue for his injured father. Sci-fi adventure, starring Will and Jaden Smith, with Sophie Okonedo.(n)

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: A giant mutant lizard spawned from an atomic test rampages through the streets of New York, defying the combined might of the US Army and Navy as it searches for a quiet place to hatch its eggs. A bookish radiation expert and a shady French secret agent join forces to defeat the creature. Hollywood remake of the Japanese monster adventure, starring Matthew Broderick, Jean Reno, Maria Pitillo and Hank Azaria.(n)

programme.title: Shin Godzilla
programme.desc: Japan is plunged into chaos upon the appearance of a giant monster. Fantasy adventure, starring Hiroki Hasegawa, Yutaka Takenouchi and Satomi Ishihara.(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: A dull American town in the middle of the desert is suddenly attacked by huge man-eating subterranean creatures. Luckily, two dimwitted but brave handymen step into the breach to lead a ragtag bunch of locals and a mismatched pair of survivalists in the battle against the gruesome worm-like monsters. Comedy horror, with Kevin Bacon, Fred Ward, Finn Carter, Michael Gross, Reba McEntire and Bobby Jacoby.(n)

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: A giant mutant lizard spawned from an atomic test rampages through the streets of New York, defying the combined might of the US Army and Navy as it searches for a quiet place to hatch its eggs. A bookish radiation expert and a shady French secret agent join forces to defeat the creature. Hollywood remake of the Japanese monster adventure, starring Matthew Broderick, Jean Reno, Maria Pitillo and Hank Azaria.(n)

programme.title: Shin Godzilla
programme.desc: Japan is plunged into chaos upon the appearance of a giant monster. Fantasy adventure, starring Hiroki Hasegawa, Yutaka Takenouchi and Satomi Ishihara.(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: A dull American town in the middle of the desert is suddenly attacked by huge man-eating subterranean creatures. Luckily, two dimwitted but brave handymen step into the breach to lead a ragtag bunch of locals and a mismatched pair of survivalists in the battle against the gruesome worm-like monsters. Comedy horror, with Kevin Bacon, Fred Ward, Finn Carter, Michael Gross, Reba McEntire and Bobby Jacoby.(n)

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: Film-makers venture deep into the Amazon jungle to document the lives of a remote tribe. However, the expedition is hijacked by a crazed hunter who plans to use them as bait to catch a gigantic killer snake. Adventure, starring Jennifer Lopez, Jon Voight, Ice Cube, Eric Stoltz and Jonathan Hyde.(n)

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: An assassination attempt is made on the life of the US president during a terrorism summit. The story unfolds from several perspectives, including that of the secret service agents charged with protecting the head of state, a news producer covering the event and a man in the crowd who may have caught the perpetrator on camera. Thriller, starring Dennis Quaid, Matthew Fox, Forest Whitaker, Sigourney Weaver and William Hurt.

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: A child psychologist, disheartened after the suicide of a former patient, takes on the case of a terrified boy haunted by ghostly apparitions, and tries to help him discover what the spirits want from him. M Night Shyamalan's supernatural thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Haley Joel Osment, Toni Collette and Olivia Williams.

programme.title: My Girl 2
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old tomboy Vada visits her uncle in Los Angeles to write a school project about her mother, who died during childbirth. Meanwhile, she meets Nick, the son of her uncle's girlfriend, who has to reluctantly chaperone Vada round her mother's old haunts - but before long romance blossoms for the pair. Comedy drama sequel, with Anna Chlumsky, Dan Aykroyd, Jamie Lee Curtis and Austin O'Brien.

programme.title: Iona
programme.desc: A woman fleeing the aftermath of a violent crime seeks refuge on the Scottish island where she grew up, bringing her teenage son with her. Her return has serious ramifications for the friends she left behind, while the boy grows to understand a simpler way of life than he is used to and discovers why his mother rebelled against it. Drama, starring Ruth Negga and Douglas Henshall.

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Which movies are doing the best business at home and across the pond? Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc: The living exhibits at New York's Museum of Natural History are shipped to Washington's Smithsonian Institution - along with the artefact that brought them to life in the first place. Nightwatchman Larry tries to retrieve it, only to find the contents of the world's largest museum have been reanimated, including a pharaoh determined to take over the world. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson and Steve Coogan.

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A cursed prince falls for a young woman after she takes the place of her abducted father in his enchanted castle, and only her love can prevent him from remaining a creature forever. Musical fairy tale, starring Emma Watson, Dan Stevens and Luke Evans.

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver with tinnitus takes part in a heist doomed to fail. Edgar Wright's music-themed action thriller, starring Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey and Jon Hamm.

programme.title: The Infiltrator
programme.desc: During the 1980s, a chameleonic US agent faces one of the most dangerous assignments of his life when he infiltrates the intricate criminal network of drug kingpin Pablo Escobar. Drama, starring Bryan Cranston, John Leguizamo and Diane Kruger.

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc: The living exhibits at New York's Museum of Natural History are shipped to Washington's Smithsonian Institution - along with the artefact that brought them to life in the first place. Nightwatchman Larry tries to retrieve it, only to find the contents of the world's largest museum have been reanimated, including a pharaoh determined to take over the world. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson and Steve Coogan.

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A cursed prince falls for a young woman after she takes the place of her abducted father in his enchanted castle, and only her love can prevent him from remaining a creature forever. Musical fairy tale, starring Emma Watson, Dan Stevens and Luke Evans.

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver with tinnitus takes part in a heist doomed to fail. Edgar Wright's music-themed action thriller, starring Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey and Jon Hamm.

programme.title: Inferno
programme.desc: Robert Langdon awakes with amnesia in an Italian hospital, and is soon on the run with a beautiful doctor. Racing to stop a devastating virus, the Da Vinci Code expert suffers shocking visions as an assassin closes in. Thriller, starring Tom Hanks, Felicity Jones and Irrfan Khan.

programme.title: It Had to Be You
programme.desc: A commitment-shy jingle writer runs for the hills when her boyfriend proposes. Romantic comedy, starring Cristin Milioti, Dan Soder and Halley Feiffer.

programme.title: The Hollow Point
programme.desc: A hard-drinking sheriff and his deputy are pitted against a sadistic cartel hitman. Crime thriller, starring Patrick Wilson, Ian McShane and John Leguizamo.

programme.title: My All-American
programme.desc: Freddie Steinmark is an underdog American footballer who battles personal problems to become a University of Texas legend. Sporting biopic, starring Aaron Eckhart, Finn Wittrock and Robin Tunney.

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: The captain of a British warship engages in a tense battle of wits and an escalating test of nerves with a French counterpart during the Napoleonic conflict, a pursuit that takes his crew on a dangerous journey along the coast of South America. Seafaring drama, adapted from Patrick O'Brian's novels, starring Russell Crowe, Paul Bettany, James D'Arcy, Billy Boyd and Edward Woodall.

programme.title: Nina
programme.desc: Troubled soul icon Nina Simone rediscovers the meaning of her life and work thanks to the support of loyal friend and assistant Clifton Henderson. Music biopic, starring Zoe Saldana, David Oyelowo and Mike Epps.

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patient's fractured mind as a 24th character attempts to dominate his body. M Night Shyamalan's thriller, starring James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy and Betty Buckley.

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: A child psychologist, disheartened after the suicide of a former patient, takes on the case of a terrified boy haunted by ghostly apparitions, and tries to help him discover what the spirits want from him. M Night Shyamalan's supernatural thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Haley Joel Osment, Toni Collette and Olivia Williams.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A bail enforcement agent is assigned the task of tracking down his own ex-wife, a wily reporter chasing a story about a murder cover-up. However, bringing his former spouse to justice is harder than he anticipated, not least because she has also been targeted by the criminal she is investigating. Action comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Jennifer Aniston, Gio Perez, Joel Garland, Jason Kolotouros and Matt Malloy.

programme.title: City of Tiny Lights
programme.desc: A hard-drinking private detective searches for a missing sex worker, leading to a dangerous world of religious fanaticism and political intrigue. London-set crime thriller from Dredd director Pete Travis, starring Riz Ahmed, Billie Piper and James Floyd.

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patient's fractured mind as a 24th character attempts to dominate his body. M Night Shyamalan's thriller, starring James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy and Betty Buckley.

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: A driverless train carrying a deadly cargo of toxic chemicals goes out of control. A veteran train operator and his rookie colleague set off in pursuit in their own locomotive, intending to bring it to a halt before it crashes and causes a major disaster. Action thriller, the final film from director Tony Scott, starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pine and Rosario Dawson.

programme.title: T2: Trainspotting
programme.desc: After 20 years abroad, Mark Renton returns to Scotland and reunites with his old friends Sick Boy, Spud, and Begbie. Danny Boyle's sequel to the 1996 drama, starring Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner and Jonny Lee Miller.

programme.title: ID2: Shadwell Army
programme.desc: A police officer goes undercover as a football hooligan to bring far-right extremists to justice. Sequel to the 1995 crime thriller, starring Simon Rivers, Linus Roache, Paul Popplewell and Andy Rush.(n)

programme.title: The Neighbour
programme.desc: When a Mississippi man comes home to find his girlfriend missing, he soon discovers the disturbing truth about his secretive neighbour. Horror thriller, starring Josh Stewart, Bill Engvall and Alex Essoe.(n)

programme.title: Texas Blood
programme.desc: A Texas cowboy and former sheriff battles to keep possession of his treasured family ranch. Drama, starring Jon Voight, James Caan and Melanie Griffith.(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: A successful investment banker is left devastated by the death of his wife. A complaint to a vending machine company sets him off on a letter-writing campaign in which he makes a series of brutally honest personal admissions, providing him with the chance to make a fresh start in his life - as soon as he has finished destroying everything that used to matter to him. Drama, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Naomi Watts and Chris Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: FBI agent Gretchen Blair finds herself caught in the middle of an elaborate mid-air heist. Thriller, starring Denise Richards, Dolph Lundgren and Chuck Liddell.(n)

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: An American youngster goes to live in China with his mother, where he becomes an outsider and falls foul of the local bullies. He receives help from the kindly school caretaker, who turns out to be a kung fu master and offers to train the boy to defend himself. Martial arts drama, with Jaden Smith and Jackie Chan.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours 2
programme.desc: A couple seek the aid of a former rival in fighting back against the raucous college sorority that moves in next door to them. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Which movies are doing the best business at home and across the pond? Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: William Shakespeare's Romeo + Juliet
programme.desc: A city is divided by the conflict between two feuding families - the fathers are bitter business rivals, and the younger generation are continually fighting in the streets. The son of one household falls in love at first sight with his enemy's daughter - but the vendetta threatens their secret romance. Baz Luhrmann's modern update of Shakespeare's tragic love story, with Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes, Pete Postlethwaite and Miriam Margolyes.(n)

programme.title: Live by Night
programme.desc: A group of Boston-bred gangsters set up shop in balmy Florida during the Prohibition era, facing off against the competition and the Ku Klux Klan. Crime drama, directed by and starring Ben Affleck, with Elle Fanning, Remo Girone and Brendan Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: An American youngster goes to live in China with his mother, where he becomes an outsider and falls foul of the local bullies. He receives help from the kindly school caretaker, who turns out to be a kung fu master and offers to train the boy to defend himself. Martial arts drama, with Jaden Smith and Jackie Chan.(n)

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: The bookish Anastasia Steele and damaged billionaire playboy Christian Grey continue their sado masochistic relationship, while their safety is threatened by strangers from his past. Erotic drama sequel to Fifty Shades of Grey, starring Dakota Johnson, Jamie Dornan and Rita Ora.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours 2
programme.desc: A couple seek the aid of a former rival in fighting back against the raucous college sorority that moves in next door to them. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: sex, lies and videotape
programme.desc: An impotent man, who delights in recording interviews with women about their sexual experiences, has a profound effect on an old friend's troubled marriage. Drama, starring James Spader, Andie MacDowell, Peter Gallagher and Laura San Giacomo.

programme.title: BSL Zone
programme.desc: Tessa Padden interviews Doug Alker, a leading figure in the Deaf community about his life and career.

programme.title: Kiki's Delivery Service
programme.desc: A witch moves to a new town, hoping to forge a life for herself. Despite the objections of the locals, a kindly baker offers her a job delivering bread by broom - but events take a strange turn when she suddenly loses her powers. Animated fantasy from Spirited Away director Hayao Miyazaki, with the voices of Kirsten Dunst, Phil Hartman, Debbie Reynolds and Janeane Garofalo.

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections. Features Danny Boyle, Amy Schumer, Chiwetel Ejiofor and more.

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Ambitious fish Oscar dreams of escaping his humdrum undersea life. His wish comes true when a gangster shark keen to escape a world of organised crime seeks his help in faking his own death. But Oscar soon finds himself out of his depth as his fearsome reputation gets out of control. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Smith, Robert De Niro, Martin Scorsese, Renee Zellweger, Angelina Jolie and Jack Black.

programme.title: Dr Dolittle
programme.desc: A doctor is stunned to discover he can talk to animals, and it is not long before his home and surgery are taken over by an assortment of ailing creatures in need of help. However, when the medic's odd behaviour attracts his colleagues' attention, he is forced to rely on his new-found furry friends to save him from the asylum. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Ossie Davis and Oliver Platt.

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent becomes Britain's leading spy following the assassination of all the country's other espionage experts. Single-handedly he sets out to unmask a mysterious villain responsible for stealing the Crown Jewels - but no one is prepared to believe a sinister billionaire is the culprit. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller.

programme.title: The Core
programme.desc: A chain of bizarre and deadly incidents in several countries leads scientists to the conclusion that the Earth's core has stopped spinning. As chaos erupts around the world, experts hatch a plan to halt the destruction and save the human race - but it involves venturing deep below the planet's surface to detonate a nuclear bomb. Sci-fi thriller, starring Aaron Eckhart, Hilary Swank, Stanley Tucci and DJ Qualls.

programme.title: Triple 9
programme.desc: Premiere. A gang of corrupt cops that carries out bank robberies under the noses of their law-abiding colleagues is blackmailed into carrying out a seemingly impossible heist by the Russian Mob. They realise that the only way to carry out the crime is to kill a police officer as a diversion. Crime thriller, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, Casey Affleck, Kate Winslet and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Kick-Ass 2
programme.desc: Amateur superhero Dave joins a team of like-minded crimefighters, while lethal young vigilante Mindy retires and tries to be a normal teenager. Both of them become targets of Dave's twisted former friend, who has reinvented himself as the world's first supervillain. Action comedy sequel, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloe Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse and Jim Carrey.

programme.title: The Girl Next Door
programme.desc: A bookish teenager is far more concerned with academic achievement than having fun, until he is smitten by a gorgeous newcomer to the neighbourhood. However, when her colourful past in the adult movie business comes to light, he is convinced it is his mission to turn the former porn star into prom queen material. Romantic comedy, starring Emile Hirsch, Elisha Cuthbert, Timothy Olyphant and James Remar.

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
programme.desc: A hapless youngster faces the daunting prospect of starting a new school year and desperately tries to impress a girl in his class. But as if that weren't enough to contend with, his parents also force him to spend more time with his bullying older brother. Children's comedy sequel, starring Zachary Gordon and Devon Bostick.

programme.title: Thunderbirds
programme.desc: Devious master criminal The Hood infiltrates International Rescue's headquarters after sending the crew on a decoy mission as part of his plan to steal five advanced rescue vehicles. However, the youngest member of the Tracy family and his friends are still on the base, and it is down to them to save the day. Sci-fi adventure based on the 1960s puppet show, with Bill Paxton, Ben Kingsley and Anthony Edwards.

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry.

programme.title: Rio 2
programme.desc: Parrots Jewel and Blu lead a happy life together in Rio with their three chicks, until they find themselves hurled into an expedition up the Amazon. The journey leads to an encounter with an old enemy, while Blu also has to win the approval of Jewel's fearsome father. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jesse Eisenberg, Anne Hathaway and Jamie Foxx.

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriend's father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard.

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: An LAPD cop discovers a psychotic criminal has planted a bomb on a crowded bus, primed to go off if the vehicle drops below 50mph. He boards the vehicle and helps a hapless passenger who has been forced to take the wheel and keep a constant speed to avoid a disaster. Action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Sandra Bullock, Dennis Hopper and Jeff Daniels.

programme.title: I Give It a Year
programme.desc: A couple marry after a whirlwind romance, but family and friends have doubts about the relationship. As their first anniversary approaches, they both begin to wonder if they are right for each other, especially when faced with more appealing alternative partners. Romantic comedy, with Rose Byrne, Rafe Spall, Anna Faris and Simon Baker.

programme.title: The Boss, Anatomy of a Crime
programme.desc: A humble man gets a job in a butcher shop, and the sinister owner slowly pressures him into a life of slavery - with ultimately tragic circumstances. Fact-based Argentinian drama, starring German de Silva, Joaquin Furriel and Andrea Garrote. In Spanish.(n)

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: A family of four-inch-high people living beneath the floorboards of an ordinary human home help the owner's son fight back when a dastardly lawyer plans to demolish the house and make way for a luxury apartment block. Children's fantasy, starring John Goodman, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, Flora Newbigin and Tom Felton.(n)

programme.title: Howl's Moving Castle
programme.desc: A girl earns the enmity of a spiteful witch, and is placed under a curse that turns her into an old woman. Taking shelter in the walking castle of a famed wizard, she encounters the demon who enables the building to move, and who offers to dispel the enchantment - if she helps to free him. Spirited Away director Hayao Miyazaki's fantasy, based on Diana Wynne Jones' novel. With the voices of Emily Mortimer, Jean Simmons, Christian Bale, Billy Crystal and Lauren Bacall.(n)

programme.title: Dr Dolittle 2
programme.desc: The vet with a talent for talking to animals comes to the aid of forest creatures that need his help protecting their homes from land developers. He also has to deal with the love life of a circus bear that has fallen for a wild female. Comedy sequel, starring Eddie Murphy and Kevin Pollak, with the voices of Steve Zahn, Lisa Kudrow and Isaac Hayes.(n)

programme.title: Short Circuit
programme.desc: A military robot is struck by lightning and develops a mind of its own. The machine embarks on a series of comic misadventures, but the company that made him wants him back. He realises his only hope is to convince the scientist who invented him that he really is alive. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Steve Guttenberg, Ally Sheedy and Fisher Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Feisty heroine Annie and her new boyfriend Alex take a cruise in the Bahamas, but the trip becomes a nightmare when they discover a vengeful computer genius - a former employee laid off because of his terminal illness - is also on board. He has secretly programmed the ship to crash into an oil tanker while he steals a cache of diamonds from the cargo. Action thriller sequel, with Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: A retired former special forces agent has the job of chauffeuring the son of a controversial Miami politician. When Russian criminals kidnap the youngster and inject him with a virus in the hope of infecting his father, the driver sets out to find the boy and his abductors. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Alessandro Gassman and Amber Valletta.(n)

programme.title: Extraterrestrial
programme.desc: Five college friends spending a weekend in a remote cabin fear for their lives when they accidentally blunder onto a conspiracy theorist's land. The situation grows far more terrifying when a UFO crash lands nearby, and the surviving occupant comes looking for human prey. Sci-fi horror, starring Brittany Allen and Freddie Stroma.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John is nervous about attending a high-school reunion, feeling that his friends have all achieved more than he has.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy shows a reporter writing a guide book around the community, but John worries about what he might uncover.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason spends too much time playing with a band. His school work, music lessons, and health begin to suffer. Meanwhile, John-Boy gets a part-time job in a library, and the librarian soon suggests he consider it as a profession.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Almanzo's brother Royal leaves his two kids with the Wilders while he and his wife take a well-earned holiday, but the youngsters prove to be quite a handful.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Farmer Joe Kagan is distraught to find out that Hester Sue, the woman he gave up everything to be with, is engaged to someone else, so he takes it upon himself to change her mind.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Jim begins spending time with a friend of Syd's who is also a photo-journalist - but she and Joanie are quick to interfere.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd is upset to learn Jim and Monica have grown closer and Joanie is rescued from a smoke-filled bakery by a handsome fireman. Robbie's streak of good luck on the game show shows no sign of running out as he continues to win huge cash prizes.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Mark asks God to make Jonathan a police officer. After 40 years, Jonathan becomes human, only to realise the harsh realities of being a cop and receive him an insight into Mark's more cynical outlook on life.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: An aspiring actress just wants to be herself, but her controlling father is determined to maintain control over her public image.

programme.title: Nora Roberts' Northern Lights
programme.desc: A Baltimore police officer tries to overcome the shock of a partner's death by taking a job in Alaska, where he strikes up a promising relationship with a female pilot. The idyll comes to a sudden halt when her father is discovered in a remote mountain cave with an axe in his chest, leaving the cop with the task of solving the murder. Romantic mystery, starring Eddie Cibrian and LeAnn Rimes.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's The Ring
programme.desc: Part one of two. A German woman flees the tyranny of the Nazis and attempts to start a new life with her army officer husband. Her happiness is short-lived, however, as tragedy strikes, leaving her pregnant and alone in an uncaring world with only her hopes to keep her going. Drama, starring Nastassja Kinski, James B Sikking and Michael York.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason looks to develop his musical skills further by applying to win a scholarship for the Klineberg Conservatory.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd faces a malpractice suit from a high-risk pregnancy patient and begins to doubt her decision to end her therapy sessions. Joanie and Phil go on a purely platonic date - but soon find their feelings getting in the way of their friendship. Ashley Johnson and Isabella Hoffman guest star.

programme.title: Anna Karenina
programme.desc: Part one of two. Adaptation of Leo Tolstoy's novel about the glamorous and tumultuous past of a Russian aristocrat. A married woman of high social standing finds herself inexplicably and unignorably attracted to the dashing Count Vronsky and the two embark on a torrid affair that threatens to undo them both. With Vittoria Puccini, Santiago Cabrera and Benjamin Sadler.

programme.title: Anna Karenina
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adaptation of Leo Tolstoy's story opening up the glamorous and tumultuous past of a Russian aristocrat. A married woman of high social standing finds herself inexplicably and unignorably attracted to the dashing Count Vronsky and the two embark on a torrid affair that threatens to undo them both. With Vittoria Puccini, Santiago Cabrera and Benjamin Sadler.

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Romantic drama based on the novel by John Jakes, telling the story of the bond formed by two military cadets in 1842 through the events that led to the American Civil War.

programme.title: The Face of Love
programme.desc: A widow begins a new relationship with a man who is the exact double of her husband, and shares many of his personality traits. Over time, she grows to love his own unique qualities, but fears he will leave her if he ever discovers the resemblance. Romantic drama, starring Annette Bening, Ed Harris and Robin Williams.

programme.title: The Face of Love
programme.desc: A widow begins a new relationship with a man who is the exact double of her husband, and shares many of his personality traits. Over time, she grows to love his own unique qualities, but fears he will leave her if he ever discovers the resemblance. Romantic drama, starring Annette Bening, Ed Harris and Robin Williams.

programme.title: Mary Higgins Clark: Loves Music, Loves to Dance
programme.desc: A tenacious TV producer sets out to get to the bottom of a friend's murder, certain that the killer was a man her pal had met online. However, it soon becomes clear that her very personal investigation has served only to place her in danger as well. Mystery, based on Mary Higgins Clark's novel, starring Patsy Kensit, Cynthia Preston and Dean McDermott.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy writes an article about a woman who performs wing walking stunts, whom Jim-Bob falls for. However, she mistakenly thinks John-Boy is her secret admirer. Maude Gormley gives her goat to the family in return for a rocking chair.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A forestry student visits the family, and Mary Ellen and Erin both fall for him.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura quits her teaching job, leaving the children to face the tender mercies of Mrs Oleson, who immediately sets about making changes to the curriculum.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Albert falls for a traumatised schoolgirl hiding a terrible secret, but her father tries to put a stop to their relationship, forcing them to meet in secret.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: A terrible headache leaves Syd experiencing bizarre hallucinations, where she encounters the characters from Alice in Wonderland. Joanie and fireman Burt look forward to a relaxing weekend away together - but find that their hosts at the remote B&B have other plans for them.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd has an out-of-body experience as Jim keeps a bedside vigil by her side. Elsewhere, Robbie is caught up in a potential scandal and firefighter Burt attempts to comfort a distraught Joanne.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Mark agrees to sell his soul in return for saving a girl's life - but unwittingly allows the Devil to obtain the spirit of an angel.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan intervenes when a factory causes water pollution, but finds the employees unwilling to help, even when their children's health is affected. Paul Walker guest stars.

programme.title: Carolina Moon
programme.desc: A woman returns to her home town, where she discovers that the killer of her childhood friend is still terrorising the community, and embarks on a mission to track him down before he claims another life. However, while trying to capture the murderer, romance unexpectedly blossoms between her and the handsome older brother of her deceased friend. Romantic mystery, starring Claire Forlani and Oliver Hudson.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's The Ring
programme.desc: Conclusion of the drama, starring Nastassja Kinski as a German woman struggling to make her way in an uncaring world. With James B Sikking, Rupert Penry-Jones and Michael York.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandpa wins a raffle, but Grandma is upset to learn that his prize is a statue that reminds him of one of his ex-girlfriends. Meanwhile, John-Boy writes a story about the failed romance between Miss Emily and Ashley Longworth.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd feels oppressed in the aftermath of the malpractice suit and Jim returns to full-time work under Sam's watchful eye. Tina seeks professional advice about childbirth, and learns she may have to undergo surgery to conceive.

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: Part one of two. Adaptation of the fairy tale set in post-war Rome, following the story of a young woman with a gift for music who is forced to work as a maid in her stepmother's hotel. With Rosabell Laurenti Sellers and Frank Crudele.

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: Concluding part of the adaptation of the fairy tale set in post-war Rome, following the story of a young woman with a gift for music who is forced to work as a maid in her stepmother's hotel. With Rosabell Laurenti Sellers and Frank Crudele.

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Period drama based on the novel by John Jakes. Two military cadets form a bond in 1842 before the Civil War that threatened to tear the US in two.

programme.title: Passchendaele
programme.desc: A Canadian soldier is injured in battle during the First World War, and falls for a nurse in the hospital. Declared unfit for duty due to ill health, he is reassigned to a recruitment station - but he tricks his way back to the front line to protect the brother of the woman he loves. Drama, directed by and starring Paul Gross. With Caroline Dhavernas and Joe Dinicol.

programme.title: Passchendaele
programme.desc: A Canadian soldier is injured in battle during the First World War, and falls for a nurse in the hospital. Declared unfit for duty due to ill health, he is reassigned to a recruitment station - but he tricks his way back to the front line to protect the brother of the woman he loves. Drama, directed by and starring Paul Gross. With Caroline Dhavernas and Joe Dinicol.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A gambler is found kicked to death - and despite the fact that he was unemployed, the team find wads of cash hidden in his flat. The discovery raises suspicions that he was involved in an illegal betting syndicate at a local stable - where a second death only serves to raise the stakes.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A new pupil at the school has troubled reading, but Elizabeth realises why and finds a way to help him.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: When young widow Olivia comes to stay in their home, the Walton children learn a hard lesson about how to cope with another person's grief.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Albert helps Sylvia to run away so she will not have to leave Walnut Grove with her father, but unknowingly reveals her whereabouts to the rapist.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Adam and Mary Kendall return to Walnut Grove to set up a law practice. However, their first client proves controversial with the neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Sydney arrives home from hospital, but has doubts about the treatment recommended to her by a handsome new-age physical therapist.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: As Hallowe'en approaches, a recovering Syd prescribes a dose that almost kills a girl, making her fear she may have returned to work too soon. To make matters worse, she also suspects her substitute, Dr Roberts, is conspiring to take over the clinic.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark help a minor league baseball team turn around their losing streak, and also come to the aid of an elderly vendor who has been banned from their ground.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.sub-title: The Smile in the Third Row
programme.desc: Jonathan is sceptical of the lead actor in a Broadway play who claims that God is attending the show's performances in a third-row orchestra seat. Guest starring Lorne Greene (Bonanza).(n)

programme.title: Ride to Freedom: The Rosa Parks Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the life of Rosa Parks, the black woman who famously refused to give up her seat on a bus to a white man in 1950s America. The action prompted a massive outpouring of anger and sparked the rise of the civil rights movement. Angela Bassett, Cicely Tyson and Peter Francis James star.(n)

programme.title: Pearl
programme.desc: Second World War drama following the lives of various people caught up in the attack on Pearl Harbor, including a colonel's embittered wife, a naval officer in love with a Japanese-American woman and a doctor troubled by her past. Starring Angie Dickinson, Dennis Weaver, Robert Wagner and Lesley Anne Warren.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben tries to win the attention of a special girl, but his attempts backfire miserably as she goes running into the arms of Jason.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd meets her attorney to discuss the malpractice suit, but a clash of egos puts her defence in jeopardy when she realises he is even more stubborn than she is. George Newbern guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Chasing Secrets
programme.desc: An abused youngster suffers at the hands of her uncaring grandparents, until she is taken under the wing of an elderly couple - who struggle to help her lay the ghosts of the past to rest. Drama, starring Della Reese, Ossie Davis and Crystal Bernhard.(n)

programme.title: Roots: The Gift
programme.desc: Two slaves in 18th-century America are taken to a plantation, where they discover the son of the owner is secretly helping his father's captive workforce to escape - giving them the chance to gain their freedom. Period drama based on the TV series, starring LeVar Burton, Louis Gossett Jr and Avery Brooks.(n)

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Period drama based on the novel by John Jakes. Two military cadets form a bond in 1842 before the Civil War that threatened to tear the US in two.(n)

programme.title: Savannah
programme.desc: A plantation owner in the early 20th century rejects his privileged background in favour of living off the land alongside a freed slave, supporting himself by hunting. When he falls in love with a high-society woman, he is forced to choose between her and his freedom. Fact-based period drama, starring Jim Caviezel, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Jaimie Alexander.(n)

programme.title: Ride to Freedom: The Rosa Parks Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the life of Rosa Parks, the black woman who famously refused to give up her seat on a bus to a white man in 1950s America. The action prompted a massive outpouring of anger and sparked the rise of the civil rights movement. Angela Bassett, Cicely Tyson and Peter Francis James star.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John is nervous about attending a high-school reunion, feeling that his friends have all achieved more than he has.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy shows a reporter writing a guide book around the community, but John worries about what he might uncover.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason spends too much time playing with a band. His school work, music lessons, and health begin to suffer. Meanwhile, John-Boy gets a part-time job in a library, and the librarian soon suggests he consider it as a profession.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Almanzo's brother Royal leaves his two kids with the Wilders while he and his wife take a well-earned holiday, but the youngsters prove to be quite a handful.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Farmer Joe Kagan is distraught to find out that Hester Sue, the woman he gave up everything to be with, is engaged to someone else, so he takes it upon himself to change her mind.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Jim begins spending time with a friend of Syd's who is also a photo-journalist - but she and Joanie are quick to interfere.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd is upset to learn Jim and Monica have grown closer and Joanie is rescued from a smoke-filled bakery by a handsome fireman. Robbie's streak of good luck on the game show shows no sign of running out as he continues to win huge cash prizes.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Mark asks God to make Jonathan a police officer. After 40 years, Jonathan becomes human, only to realise the harsh realities of being a cop and receive him an insight into Mark's more cynical outlook on life.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: An aspiring actress just wants to be herself, but her controlling father is determined to maintain control over her public image.

programme.title: Nora Roberts' Northern Lights
programme.desc: A Baltimore police officer tries to overcome the shock of a partner's death by taking a job in Alaska, where he strikes up a promising relationship with a female pilot. The idyll comes to a sudden halt when her father is discovered in a remote mountain cave with an axe in his chest, leaving the cop with the task of solving the murder. Romantic mystery, starring Eddie Cibrian and LeAnn Rimes.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's The Ring
programme.desc: Part one of two. A German woman flees the tyranny of the Nazis and attempts to start a new life with her army officer husband. Her happiness is short-lived, however, as tragedy strikes, leaving her pregnant and alone in an uncaring world with only her hopes to keep her going. Drama, starring Nastassja Kinski, James B Sikking and Michael York.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason looks to develop his musical skills further by applying to win a scholarship for the Klineberg Conservatory.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd faces a malpractice suit from a high-risk pregnancy patient and begins to doubt her decision to end her therapy sessions. Joanie and Phil go on a purely platonic date - but soon find their feelings getting in the way of their friendship. Ashley Johnson and Isabella Hoffman guest star.

programme.title: Anna Karenina
programme.desc: Part one of two. Adaptation of Leo Tolstoy's novel about the glamorous and tumultuous past of a Russian aristocrat. A married woman of high social standing finds herself inexplicably and unignorably attracted to the dashing Count Vronsky and the two embark on a torrid affair that threatens to undo them both. With Vittoria Puccini, Santiago Cabrera and Benjamin Sadler.

programme.title: Anna Karenina
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adaptation of Leo Tolstoy's story opening up the glamorous and tumultuous past of a Russian aristocrat. A married woman of high social standing finds herself inexplicably and unignorably attracted to the dashing Count Vronsky and the two embark on a torrid affair that threatens to undo them both. With Vittoria Puccini, Santiago Cabrera and Benjamin Sadler.

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Romantic drama based on the novel by John Jakes, telling the story of the bond formed by two military cadets in 1842 through the events that led to the American Civil War.

programme.title: The Face of Love
programme.desc: A widow begins a new relationship with a man who is the exact double of her husband, and shares many of his personality traits. Over time, she grows to love his own unique qualities, but fears he will leave her if he ever discovers the resemblance. Romantic drama, starring Annette Bening, Ed Harris and Robin Williams.

programme.title: The Face of Love
programme.desc: A widow begins a new relationship with a man who is the exact double of her husband, and shares many of his personality traits. Over time, she grows to love his own unique qualities, but fears he will leave her if he ever discovers the resemblance. Romantic drama, starring Annette Bening, Ed Harris and Robin Williams.

programme.title: Mary Higgins Clark: Loves Music, Loves to Dance
programme.desc: A tenacious TV producer sets out to get to the bottom of a friend's murder, certain that the killer was a man her pal had met online. However, it soon becomes clear that her very personal investigation has served only to place her in danger as well. Mystery, based on Mary Higgins Clark's novel, starring Patsy Kensit, Cynthia Preston and Dean McDermott.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy writes an article about a woman who performs wing walking stunts, whom Jim-Bob falls for. However, she mistakenly thinks John-Boy is her secret admirer. Maude Gormley gives her goat to the family in return for a rocking chair.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A forestry student visits the family, and Mary Ellen and Erin both fall for him.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura quits her teaching job, leaving the children to face the tender mercies of Mrs Oleson, who immediately sets about making changes to the curriculum.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Albert falls for a traumatised schoolgirl hiding a terrible secret, but her father tries to put a stop to their relationship, forcing them to meet in secret.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: A terrible headache leaves Syd experiencing bizarre hallucinations, where she encounters the characters from Alice in Wonderland. Joanie and fireman Burt look forward to a relaxing weekend away together - but find that their hosts at the remote B&B have other plans for them.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd has an out-of-body experience as Jim keeps a bedside vigil by her side. Elsewhere, Robbie is caught up in a potential scandal and firefighter Burt attempts to comfort a distraught Joanne.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Mark agrees to sell his soul in return for saving a girl's life - but unwittingly allows the Devil to obtain the spirit of an angel.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan intervenes when a factory causes water pollution, but finds the employees unwilling to help, even when their children's health is affected. Paul Walker guest stars.

programme.title: Carolina Moon
programme.desc: A woman returns to her home town, where she discovers that the killer of her childhood friend is still terrorising the community, and embarks on a mission to track him down before he claims another life. However, while trying to capture the murderer, romance unexpectedly blossoms between her and the handsome older brother of her deceased friend. Romantic mystery, starring Claire Forlani and Oliver Hudson.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's The Ring
programme.desc: Conclusion of the drama, starring Nastassja Kinski as a German woman struggling to make her way in an uncaring world. With James B Sikking, Rupert Penry-Jones and Michael York.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandpa wins a raffle, but Grandma is upset to learn that his prize is a statue that reminds him of one of his ex-girlfriends. Meanwhile, John-Boy writes a story about the failed romance between Miss Emily and Ashley Longworth.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd feels oppressed in the aftermath of the malpractice suit and Jim returns to full-time work under Sam's watchful eye. Tina seeks professional advice about childbirth, and learns she may have to undergo surgery to conceive.

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: Part one of two. Adaptation of the fairy tale set in post-war Rome, following the story of a young woman with a gift for music who is forced to work as a maid in her stepmother's hotel. With Rosabell Laurenti Sellers and Frank Crudele.

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: Concluding part of the adaptation of the fairy tale set in post-war Rome, following the story of a young woman with a gift for music who is forced to work as a maid in her stepmother's hotel. With Rosabell Laurenti Sellers and Frank Crudele.

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Period drama based on the novel by John Jakes. Two military cadets form a bond in 1842 before the Civil War that threatened to tear the US in two.

programme.title: Passchendaele
programme.desc: A Canadian soldier is injured in battle during the First World War, and falls for a nurse in the hospital. Declared unfit for duty due to ill health, he is reassigned to a recruitment station - but he tricks his way back to the front line to protect the brother of the woman he loves. Drama, directed by and starring Paul Gross. With Caroline Dhavernas and Joe Dinicol.

programme.title: Passchendaele
programme.desc: A Canadian soldier is injured in battle during the First World War, and falls for a nurse in the hospital. Declared unfit for duty due to ill health, he is reassigned to a recruitment station - but he tricks his way back to the front line to protect the brother of the woman he loves. Drama, directed by and starring Paul Gross. With Caroline Dhavernas and Joe Dinicol.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A gambler is found kicked to death - and despite the fact that he was unemployed, the team find wads of cash hidden in his flat. The discovery raises suspicions that he was involved in an illegal betting syndicate at a local stable - where a second death only serves to raise the stakes.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A new pupil at the school has troubled reading, but Elizabeth realises why and finds a way to help him.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: When young widow Olivia comes to stay in their home, the Walton children learn a hard lesson about how to cope with another person's grief.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Albert helps Sylvia to run away so she will not have to leave Walnut Grove with her father, but unknowingly reveals her whereabouts to the rapist.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Adam and Mary Kendall return to Walnut Grove to set up a law practice. However, their first client proves controversial with the neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Sydney arrives home from hospital, but has doubts about the treatment recommended to her by a handsome new-age physical therapist.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: As Hallowe'en approaches, a recovering Syd prescribes a dose that almost kills a girl, making her fear she may have returned to work too soon. To make matters worse, she also suspects her substitute, Dr Roberts, is conspiring to take over the clinic.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark help a minor league baseball team turn around their losing streak, and also come to the aid of an elderly vendor who has been banned from their ground.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.sub-title: The Smile in the Third Row
programme.desc: Jonathan is sceptical of the lead actor in a Broadway play who claims that God is attending the show's performances in a third-row orchestra seat. Guest starring Lorne Greene (Bonanza).(n)

programme.title: Ride to Freedom: The Rosa Parks Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the life of Rosa Parks, the black woman who famously refused to give up her seat on a bus to a white man in 1950s America. The action prompted a massive outpouring of anger and sparked the rise of the civil rights movement. Angela Bassett, Cicely Tyson and Peter Francis James star.(n)

programme.title: Pearl
programme.desc: Second World War drama following the lives of various people caught up in the attack on Pearl Harbor, including a colonel's embittered wife, a naval officer in love with a Japanese-American woman and a doctor troubled by her past. Starring Angie Dickinson, Dennis Weaver, Robert Wagner and Lesley Anne Warren.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben tries to win the attention of a special girl, but his attempts backfire miserably as she goes running into the arms of Jason.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd meets her attorney to discuss the malpractice suit, but a clash of egos puts her defence in jeopardy when she realises he is even more stubborn than she is. George Newbern guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Chasing Secrets
programme.desc: An abused youngster suffers at the hands of her uncaring grandparents, until she is taken under the wing of an elderly couple - who struggle to help her lay the ghosts of the past to rest. Drama, starring Della Reese, Ossie Davis and Crystal Bernhard.(n)

programme.title: Roots: The Gift
programme.desc: Two slaves in 18th-century America are taken to a plantation, where they discover the son of the owner is secretly helping his father's captive workforce to escape - giving them the chance to gain their freedom. Period drama based on the TV series, starring LeVar Burton, Louis Gossett Jr and Avery Brooks.(n)

programme.title: North and South
programme.desc: Period drama based on the novel by John Jakes. Two military cadets form a bond in 1842 before the Civil War that threatened to tear the US in two.(n)

programme.title: Savannah
programme.desc: A plantation owner in the early 20th century rejects his privileged background in favour of living off the land alongside a freed slave, supporting himself by hunting. When he falls in love with a high-society woman, he is forced to choose between her and his freedom. Fact-based period drama, starring Jim Caviezel, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Jaimie Alexander.(n)

programme.title: First Pitch
programme.desc: The President tries to prove he's a man's man by throwing out the first pitch at a Washington Nationals game, while Ivanka attempts to become a feminist icon by opening a school for girls.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: Undeniable
programme.desc: This comedy special is Griffin's magnum opus about the world, relationships and humanity as a whole. He celebrates his 30-year anniversary in comedy by being on stage and pulling laughter from his fans during the live taping.

programme.title: Double Take
programme.desc: Framed in a multimillion-dollar laundering scheme, upstanding investment banker Daryl (Orlando Jones) suddenly finds himself running from the FBI and swapping identities with petty thief Freddy (Eddie Griffin). As he dashes for the Mexican border in search of the one man who can clear his name, Daryl discovers his new alias is even more wanted than he is.

programme.title: The 4th
programme.desc: Jamie is a down-on-his-luck illustrator who's behind on rent and tries to throw a cookout while his overbearing roommate is out of town on the 4th of July. He decides to borrow his roommate's bike for a quick trip to buy lighter fluid, but his entire day and life quickly go up in smoke. After an incident with a road-rager, Jamie finds himself far from home and trapped in a series of awkward and infuriating situations with strangers.

programme.title: The Hallow
programme.desc: Adam Hitchens is a London-based conservationist, husband and father who has found himself struggling amidst fraught economic pressures at work. He decides to move his family from London to Ireland and to take a job surveying an Irish forest. He moves his family to a millhouse deep in the idyllic countryside of Ireland. When the family arrives, they get to work rebuilding their new home. They meet their neighbors, but not everyone approves of their arrival. The locals are unfriendly and begin to make them feel unwanted.

programme.title: Don't Sleep
programme.desc: Shawn and Zach are young lovers who move into a guesthouse together on an estate owned by Mr. and Mrs. Marino. When bizarre events begin to occur, Zach slowly remembers a forgotten time in his childhood when he suffered from severe and violent psychosis - memories erased by a series of electroconvulsive shock treatments administered by his psychiatrist. As the terrors surrounding their lives grow to deadly proportions, Zach is forced to question his own sanity.

programme.title: Get The Gringo
programme.desc: An already bad day for Driver is not getting any better. He makes a big haul of millions that would give him a nice summer vacation on easy street, but it goes south - literally. During a high-speed car chase with the US Border Patrol and a bleeding body in his back seat, Driver flips his car smashing through the border wall, tumbling violently, coming to a stop in Mexico. Apprehended by the Mexican authorities, he is sent to a hard-core prison where he enters the strange and dangerous world of "El Pueblito". Starring Mel Gibson.

programme.title: Assassination Games
programme.desc: Jack and Derek are the two best assassins in the world. Conway is a master sharpshooter and Chase is equally skilled with a knife. The two rivals must form an uneasy alliance to take down the head of a drug cartel backed by the DEA.

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: A woman emerges from a coma four years after taking a bullet to the head at her own wedding, and goes on an epic vendetta against her former boss and his deadly squad of international assassins in a kill or be-killed fight. Directed by Quentin Tarantino; stars Uma Thurman and Lucy Liu.

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: In this sequel to the Quentin Tarantino cult classic, a murderous bride continues her quest for vengeance against her former boss and lover and those who betrayed her, leading up to the ultimate confrontation with the man who ordered her execution. Stars Uma Thurman.

programme.title: The Punisher
programme.desc: Thomas Jane ("Deep Blue Sea," "Dreamcatcher") steps into the steel-tipped boots of Marvel Comics hero Frank Castle, a.k.a. The Punisher, a crusading vigilante out to topple the crime czar (John Travolta) who murdered his family. Rebecca Romijn, Ben Foster, Samantha Mathis, Roy Scheider and Will Patton costar in this crackling adaptation from writer/director Jonathan Hensleigh ("Jumanji," "Armageddon").

programme.title: Get The Gringo
programme.desc: An already bad day for Driver is not getting any better. He makes a big haul of millions that would give him a nice summer vacation on easy street, but it goes south - literally. During a high-speed car chase with the US Border Patrol and a bleeding body in his back seat, Driver flips his car smashing through the border wall, tumbling violently, coming to a stop in Mexico. Apprehended by the Mexican authorities, he is sent to a hard-core prison where he enters the strange and dangerous world of "El Pueblito". Starring Mel Gibson.

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: A vengeful game of one-upmanship turns deadly in this urban thriller about a hotshot young attorney (Ben Affleck) and a recovering alcoholic (Samuel L. Jackson) whose minor fender-bender devastates both of their lives and quickly leads to an escalating war of dirty tricks and manipulation. William Hurt, Toni Collette, Dylan Baker, Amanda Peet and Sydney Pollack costar in this provocative, acclaimed film from director Roger Michell ("Notting Hill").

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: David Dunn (Bruce Willis) emerges from a horrific train crash without a single scratch on him. He meets a mysterious stranger (Samuel L. Jackson) whose obsession with David will change David's life forever.

programme.title: Band Aid
programme.desc: Anna (Zoe Lister-Jones) and Ben (Adam Pally) are a couple who can't stop fighting. Advised by their therapist to try and work through their grief unconventionally, they are reminded of their shared love of music. In a last-ditch effort to save their marriage, they decide to turn all their fights into song, and with the help of their neighbor Dave (Fred Armisen), they start a band.

programme.title: Employee of the Month (2006)
programme.desc: A slacker box boy (Dane Cook) at a New Mexico superstore tries to impress a gorgeous new coworker (Jessica Simpson) by transforming himself into a model corporate drone, but runs up against the previous 17-time holder (Dax Shepard) of the store's "employee of the month" honor.

programme.title: In & Out
programme.desc: Welcome to Greenleaf, a picture-perfect Indiana town where the high school is the proud focus of attention. On the night of the Oscars telecast, the town's center of attention is Greenleaf teacher Howard Brackett when a former student, who's now a winning actor, tells the audience of millions that Howard is gay. Kevin Kline plays stunned Howard, who scrambles to go forth with his wedding to devoted Emily (Joan Cusack) and assert his manliness.

programme.title: The Weather Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage stars in this comedy-drama as a Chicago weather man whose personal life enters free-fall even as his career is potentially about to take off with a new job on a national television morning show. Michael Caine and Hope Davis costar in this film from director Gore Verbinski ("The Ring," "Pirates of the Caribbean").

programme.title: New Wave: Dare to be Different
programme.desc: In August, 1982, a small group of radio visionaries at WLIR Long Island knew they couldn't compete with the mega radio stations in New York City. With one brave decision, they changed the sound of radio forever. Program Director Denis McNamara, the crew at the station and the biggest artists of the era tell the story of how they battled the FCC, the record labels, mega-radio and all the conventional rules to create a musical movement that brought the New Wave to America - including bands like U2, Talking Heads, Depeche Mode and Blondie.

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: David Dunn (Bruce Willis) emerges from a horrific train crash without a single scratch on him. He meets a mysterious stranger (Samuel L. Jackson) whose obsession with David will change David's life forever.

programme.title: Operation Odessa
programme.desc: This is a true crime documentary featuring a Russian mobster, a Miami playboy and a Cuban spy who sold a Soviet submarine to a Colombian drug cartel for $35 million. A mid-'90s gangster epic that hopscotches from Brooklyn to Miami and Cali to Moscow, the film tells the story of three friends who set out to hustle the Russian mob, the Cali cartel and the DEA for the score of a lifetime.

programme.title: The (Mis)Education of Liam Fergus Beircheart Gallagher
programme.desc: As Fiona tries to raise the profile of the neighborhood, Ian helps Trevor to raise money for a new youth shelter. Meanwhile, Carl loses his scholarship and gets creative with securing the tuition, Lip stands up to a friend and gets hurt and Frank teaches the parents at Liam's school all about the working class.(n)
