programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: A rich Wall Street player (Christian Bale) basks in his late-1980s yuppie lifestyle, but behind his slick appearance lurks a murderous monster. Jared Leto, Willem Dafoe, Samantha Mathis, Chloe Sevigny, Reese Witherspoon, Josh Lucas. Contains extra footage not shown in theaters. Mary Harron directed the adaptation of Bret Easton Ellis's controversial novel. (cc).

programme.title: Shine
programme.desc: Geoffrey Rush won an Oscar for his portrayal of piano prodigy David Helfgott, whose domineering father (Armin Mueller-Stahl) caused him to have a mental breakdown. David (teen): Noah Taylor. Gillian: Lynn Redgrave. Prof. Parkes: John Gielgud. Directed by Scott Hicks. (cc).

programme.title: Empire
programme.desc: An ambitious South Bronx drug dealer gets in over his head when he becomes involved in an investment scheme with a shady Wall Street banker. He discovers going straight is a more complicated matter than he ever imagined. (cc).

programme.title: The Verdict
programme.desc: An alcoholic lawyer thinks he can make some quick cash getting a settlement for the family of a woman who is in a coma after being operated on at a Catholic hospital. However, he becomes emotionally involved in the case, turns down the offer, and takes the powerful institution to court. (cc).

programme.title: 5 Flights Up
programme.desc: When an elderly couple discover that their Brooklyn apartment has increased in value, they decide to sell and move to Manhattan. However, they soon learn that relocating won't be easy. (cc).

programme.title: The Limey
programme.desc: Terence Stamp gives a compellingly taut performance in this thriller about a criminal who is released from jail and makes looking for his daughter's murderer his first order of business. Lesley Ann Warren. Ed: Luis Guzman. Avery: Barry Newman. John: Joe Dallesandro. Directed by Steven Soderbergh. (cc).

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: A biography of Howard Hughes, centering on his glory years from the 1920s to the 1940s. After making a fortune improving the design of oil drilling bits, Hughes becomes the Hollywood mogul behind RKO studios, and devotes his life to aviation. The film also depicts Hughes' romances Hollywood starlets Jean Harlow and Katharine Hepburn. (cc).

programme.title: The Hunted
programme.desc: A retired tracker hunts down a former soldier who's on a killing spree in the Oregon wilderness. (cc).

programme.title: The Thin Red Line
programme.desc: World War II epic follows a squad of GIs advancing on Guadalcanal. One solider, Private Witt, is a deserter living in peace and harmony with the natives of a Pacific island paradise. However, Witt's respite from war is brief as he's captured by the Navy and forced back into combat. (cc).

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Now fully recovered from his amnesia, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne attempts to uncover the truth behind his father's death, while simultaneously exacting revenge and evading the government forces hot on his trail. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: An Oscar-winning screenplay by costars Matt Damon and Ben Affleck propels this tale about a brilliant but undisciplined janitor who confronts his problems with the help of a therapist (Robin Williams, who also won an Oscar). (cc).(n)

programme.title: Lowriders
programme.desc: An aimless young street artist in L.A. named Danny finds himself torn between the lowrider car culture of his father and his desire for a creative outlet. This generational clash is further complicated when Danny's older brother returns home from prison. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Underworld *
programme.desc: A centuries-old war between vampires and werewolves, and a vampire-hunting human who becomes entangled in their conflict. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: This adaptation of the classic TV spy spoof revives inept agent Maxwell Smart of the top-secret agency CONTROL, and unleashes him on the modern world. His partner is beautiful, deadly Agent 99, who would rather battle the forces of KAOS alone than with the inexperienced Max at her side. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: Brendan Fraser is a raider of the lost sarcophagus in this high-tech, effects-filled remake of the 1932 Universal Pictures horror classic. Evelyn: Rachel Weisz. Jonathan: John Hannah. Imhotep: Arnold Vosloo. Directed by Stephen Sommers. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Rules Don't Apply
programme.desc: In 1958 Hollywood, a romance blossoms between a pious actress and a right-wing chauffeur—even though both of them work for reclusive billionaire Howard Hughes, who forbids his employees to date each other. Their secret liaison plays out while Hughes' aviation innovations keep pace with his debilitating eccentricities. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Invincible
programme.desc: This true-life football saga centers on Vince Papale, a 30-year-old sandlot player who earned a spot on the 1976 Philadelphia Eagles. In time, Papale becomes a special-teams star and fan favorite. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Blow
programme.desc: In this fact-based biopic, Johnny Depp plays George Jung, an American said to have been the nation's top supplier of cocaine in the '70s and '80s. Mirtha: Penelope Cruz. Delgado: Jordi Molla. Barbara: Franka Potente. Fred Jung: Ray Liotta. Ermine: Rachel Griffiths. Tuna: Ethan Suplee. Derek: Paul Reubens. Dulli: Max Perlich. Escobar: Cliff Curtis. Oliveras: Miguel Sandoval. Minghella: Kevin Gage. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Oscar winner Julia Roberts as a sassy, low-level law-office worker who becomes obsessed with a case involving a California utility company that's accused of polluting the drinking water in a small town. The real-life Erin Brockovich has a cameo as a waitress named Julia. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Taking Woodstock
programme.desc: Demetri Martin stars in this historical comedy-drama about the celebrated 1969 festival of peace and love. Martin plays Elliot Teichberg, an interior designer who offers to help out the promoters of Woodstock when they lose their permit to have the concert. He provides a space for the show, but must think on his feet when the entire event becomes much larger than he imagined. Directed by Ang Lee. Eugene Levy, Emile Hirsch, Liev Schreiber. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: This biopic of airline pilot Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger depicts his successful emergency landing of an Airbus A320 on the Hudson River in January 2009. In the aftermath of this unprecedented feat, he must endure the weight of sudden fame, second-guessing by investigators and his own doubts about his actions that fateful day. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Howards End *
programme.desc: In the premiere of this miniseries, spring of 1905 in England, Margaret Schlegel is at home with her Aunt Juley and her brother Tibby in the spring of 1905 in England when she receives a letter from her younger sister Helen, currently visiting the Wilcox family at their country home, Howards End. On hearing that Helen has fallen for the youngest Wilcox son, Paul, Aunt Juley is swiftly dispatched to Howards End. (cc).

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

She's mortified when she realises what she's done and she and the others concoct a plan to return the tie and right the wrong. The plan gets complicated and involves trying to extract a thumb print from head teacher, Mrs Griggs. The girls do manage to return the tie - but in the process Lily ends up `stealing' hundreds of pounds, when Matt and the football team hand her all their football trip money.(n)
